ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: A woman who is drinking heavily can still give legal consent to sexual activity.
Notes: 1= Not at all agree; 7= Very much agree

ElementDescription: A person who is sexually assaulted after drinking alcohol should only blame him- or herself.
Notes: 1= Not at all agree; 7= Very much agree

ElementDescription: Consensual drunk sex is a normal and harmless part of college life.
Notes: 1= Not at all agree; 7= Very much agree

ElementDescription: Alcohol is the most common date rape drug (or substance). (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Very much agree; 7= Not at all agree

ElementDescription: When a person is drinking alcohol, he or she is implying interest in engaging in sexual activity.
Notes: 1= Not at all agree; 7= Very much agree

ElementDescription: If both partners are drunk and have sex, there is no way the man can be accused of sexual assault or rape.
Notes: 1= Not at all agree; 7= Very much agree

ElementDescription: The more alcohol a person has consumed, the less able he/she is to consent to sexual activity. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Very much agree; 7= Not at all agree

ElementDescription: For men, intoxication is not a defense against the charge of rape or sexual assault. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Very much agree; 7= Not at all agree

ElementDescription: If a person who has been drinking becomes sleepy or unconscious, he/she cannot give consent to any sexual activity. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Very much agree; 7= Not at all agree

ElementDescription: When alcohol is involved in a sexual situation, communication signals are easily misinterpreted. (Reverse Scoring)
Notes: 1= Very much agree; 7= Not at all agree

ElementDescription: As a general rule, alcohol makes sexual situations easier and more enjoyable for both men and women.
Notes: 1= Not at all agree; 7= Very much agree

ElementDescription: Alcohol use is makes a person more vulnerable to sexual assault. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 1= Very much agree; 7= Not at all agree

ElementDescription: Alcohol and Sexual Consent Scale - Total Score
Notes: Sum of items ascs01 through ascs12

ElementDescription: Please rank each item to indicate your level of agreement: A person who is drunk can still give consent to sexual activity.
Notes: 5= Strongly Agree; 4= Agree; 3= Undecided; 2= Disagree; 1= Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: Please rank each item to indicate your level of agreement: A person who is sexually assaulted after drinking alcohol should only blame themselves
Notes: 5= Strongly Agree; 4= Agree; 3= Undecided; 2= Disagree; 1= Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: Please rank each item to indicate your level of agreement: Consensual drunk sex is a normal and harmless part of college life.
Notes: 5= Strongly Agree; 4= Agree; 3= Undecided; 2= Disagree; 1= Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: Please rank each item to indicate your level of agreement: Alcohol is the most common date rape drug (or substance).
Notes: 5= Strongly Agree; 4= Agree; 3= Undecided; 2= Disagree; 1= Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: Please rank each item to indicate your level of agreement: When a person is drinking alcohol, they are implying interest in engaging in sexual activity.
Notes: 5= Strongly Agree; 4= Agree; 3= Undecided; 2= Disagree; 1= Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: Please rank each item to indicate your level of agreement: If both partners are drunk and have sex, there is no way either partner can be accused of sexual assault or rape.
Notes: 5= Strongly Agree; 4= Agree; 3= Undecided; 2= Disagree; 1= Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: Please rank each item to indicate your level of agreement: The more alcohol a person has consumed, the less able they are to consent to sexual activity.
Notes: 5= Strongly Agree; 4= Agree; 3= Undecided; 2= Disagree; 1= Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: Please rank each item to indicate your level of agreement: Intoxication is not a defense against the charge of rape or sexual assault.
Notes: 5= Strongly Agree; 4= Agree; 3= Undecided; 2= Disagree; 1= Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: Please rank each item to indicate your level of agreement: If a person who has been drinking becomes sleepy or unconscious, they cannot give consent to any sexual activity.
Notes: 5= Strongly Agree; 4= Agree; 3= Undecided; 2= Disagree; 1= Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: Please rank each item to indicate your level of agreement: When alcohol is involved in a sexual encounter, communication signals are easily misinterpreted.
Notes: 5= Strongly Agree; 4= Agree; 3= Undecided; 2= Disagree; 1= Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: Please rank each item to indicate your level of agreement: As a general rule, alcohol makes sexual encounters easier and more enjoyable for both parties.
Notes: 5= Strongly Agree; 4= Agree; 3= Undecided; 2= Disagree; 1= Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: Please rank each item to indicate your level of agreement: Alcohol use makes a person more vulnerable to sexual assault.
Notes: 5= Strongly Agree; 4= Agree; 3= Undecided; 2= Disagree; 1= Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: How abusive is pressuring someone to have sex when they have said no?
Notes:
0= Not Abusive; 1= A Little Abusive; 2= Somewhat Abusive; 
3= Very Abusive; 4= Extremely Abusive

ElementDescription: How abusive is refusing to use a condom when someone asks to use one?
Notes:
0= Not Abusive; 1= A Little Abusive; 2= Somewhat Abusive; 
3= Very Abusive; 4= Extremely Abusive

ElementDescription: How abusive is preventing someone from using birth control when they want to use it?
Notes:
0= Not Abusive; 1= A Little Abusive; 2= Somewhat Abusive; 
3= Very Abusive; 4= Extremely Abusive

ElementDescription: How abusive is trying to get someone pregnant when they do not want to be?
Notes:
0= Not Abusive; 1= A Little Abusive; 2= Somewhat Abusive; 
3= Very Abusive; 4= Extremely Abusive

ElementDescription: How abusive is trying to make someone have an abortion when they do not want one?
Notes:
0= Not Abusive; 1= A Little Abusive; 2= Somewhat Abusive; 
3= Very Abusive; 4= Extremely Abusive

ElementDescription: How abusive is trying to make someone keep a pregnancy that they do not want?
Notes:
0= Not Abusive; 1= A Little Abusive; 2= Somewhat Abusive; 
3= Very Abusive; 4= Extremely Abusive

ElementDescription: How abusive is accusing your partner of cheating when they want to use a condom?
Notes:
0= Not Abusive; 1= A Little Abusive; 2= Somewhat Abusive; 
3= Very Abusive; 4= Extremely Abusive

ElementDescription: How abusive is threatening to leave someone if they do not have sex (including oral, vaginal, or anal)?
Notes:
0= Not Abusive; 1= A Little Abusive; 2= Somewhat Abusive; 
3= Very Abusive; 4= Extremely Abusive

ElementDescription: How abusive is threatening to have sex with others if they do not have sex (including oral, vaginal, or anal sex)?
Notes:
0= Not Abusive; 1= A Little Abusive; 2= Somewhat Abusive; 
3= Very Abusive; 4= Extremely Abusive

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2; Morning, At Bedtime
